noun.description: A movement or series of moves requiring skill and care.
examples: spectacular jumps and other daring maneuvers

noun.description: A large-scale military exercise of troops, warships, and other forces.
examples: the Russian vessel was on maneuvers
the truck was unable to maneuver comfortably in the narrow street
I'm maneuvering a loaded tray around the floor

verb.description: Carefully guide or manipulate (someone or something) in order to achieve an end.
examples: they were maneuvering him into a betrayal of his countryman

origin: Mid 18th century (as a noun in the sense tactical movement): from French manœuvre (noun), manœuvrer (verb), from medieval Latin manuoperare from Latin manus hand + operari to work.
